description: Seminar in Metaphysics: What Exists? In this seminar we will try to devise a list of entities that are metaphysically fundamental -- no small task. One route in will be via examining, and reacting to, a very mainstream metaphysical system: the metaphysical system of the proponents of "Humean Supervenience," (e.g., David Lewis, Barry Loewer). This project takes laws of nature, causation and dispositions as being non-fundamental. We will also strive to craft a fundamental ontology through considering the following issues: how contemporary physics informs metaphysics, whether there really is a meaningful physical/non-physical distinction, whether reality is informational, and the nature of mind and consciousness. (Readings include a book by Ladyman and Ross, Everything Must Go, as well as articles/chapters by Chalmers, Armstrong, Maudlin and others).
name: TOPICS IN METAPHYSICS
